page.title: 06TRANSPORT IN NETHERBURY
page.content: Public transport is almost non-existent. A single-decker bus plies 5 times most days through Netherbury between Bridport and Beaminster, but not Sundays! Stoke Abbott has a bus to Bridport and back on market days - Wednesdays and Saturdays. Of necessity almost everyone has a car, many families having one each. As soon as they are old enough the boys are on noisy motor-bikes and a few people venture out on push bikes but, as the area is very hilly and the lanes narrow, this can be quite adventurous, if not positively dangerous. Also, the Churches have a "Pastoral Care" group with volunteer drivers who are willing to transport people for hospital visiting.
